paragraphs.name: cccb
paragraphs.text: However, it’s also not easy to live a productive life. And it’s definitely not about technology or hacks. It’s about developing a sustainable system to build your life, career, and business on.

paragraphs.name: f75b
paragraphs.text: “The office is too loud.”

I exercise my mental toughness every day. I used to neglect my brain. I was mentally weak, thought too much, and didn’t rely on myself. It wasn’t because I lacked skills. It was because I didn’t trust in my ability to figure things out. So I started reading about Stoicism, Pragmatism and Mindfulness; anything that helps you to control your thoughts and improve your mental toughness. I don’t want to be a slave to my thoughts. I want the opposite.
paragraphs.name: a748

paragraphs.text: What’s your system for living a productive life?
paragraphs.name: e839

paragraphs.text: I exercise my body every day. When I don’t exercise, I’m restless, lack focus, energy, and confidence. By exercising my brain and body every day, I’m always war-ready. I learned that overcoming procrastination starts before you fight the war. Soldiers don’t go to war untrained either, right? Be in great shape, mentally and physically. Always.

So I did some freelancing. I built websites, did copywriting, content marketing, and some design work. But it didn’t take off. Why? I never did the uncomfortable work. Instead, I found a job to escape those hard tasks.
paragraphs.name: b65c

paragraphs.text: Great written Darius! You always inspire me! I love reading information that is from personal experience. I am starting to feel more confident and prepared for the future. My system for living an productive life is…

paragraphs.text: This was just what I needed to read after I just spent an hour on Instagram and Medium. As simple as Do It Today, Not tomorrow sounds – it’s bizarrely…helpful. I also wonder if I’ll ever be able to *beat* procrastination, I guess it’s like getting fit & healthy – some months I’ll be fit as hell, then comes Winter or maybe a new love interest…and I…
Great point, Manuel! Confidence is important. And the good thing is that the more work you get done, the more confident you’ll become. It’s a positive cycle.
